result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:20 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Christina Marie Rodekamp in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Christina Marie Rodekamp.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Erickson states that the test results have not been received yet
Comments by Atty Steiner - likely to be Jan before we have results, requests tentative trial dates be set
Atty Erickson requests def's phone #
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

     Atty. Erickson states test results are not back yet per the D.A.  D.A. comments.
     Court reschedules.  Court concludes at 3:26 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christina Marie Rodekamp appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Christina Marie Rodekamp.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
A request for substitution had been filed. The substitution for Judge has been approved.

2:59 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christina Marie Rodekamp appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Christina Marie Rodekamp.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Steiner is heard. 

1W - Deputy Kyle Mezera, sworn 
Exam by Atty Steiner 
Cross by Atty Erickson 

Atty Steiner is heard. State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:42 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christina Marie Rodekamp appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Christina Marie Rodekamp.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Ready to set case for a preliminary hearing. Hearing to be conducted via zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:35 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christina Marie Rodekamp in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Bond will remain the same.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:24 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christina M Rodekamp appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

DA is heard on bond. Requests a $200.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if refused or results are positive, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $200.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if refused or results are positive, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
